page.title: 06Freeman's Woodyard.
page.content: Freeman's also buy English timber. They used to cut down their own trees but now they employ other people. We saw tree trunks being cut up with a saw that is a continuous band,powered by electricity.Some of the sawn wood goes into a machine called a planer to make it very smooth. They used to use steam traction engines with big belts to drive the machinery.They also pulled the timber wagons.You can still see a place by the River Itchen in the village where they got water for their boilers. All the timber is stored under cover in big wooden sheds with slats to let the air through to help the wood to dry.
